Class ConsoleConfig

java.lang.Object
io.github.lambdaphoenix.simpleterminal.core.ConsoleConfig
public final class ConsoleConfig extends Object
Provides global configuration defaults for the SimpleTerminal library.

The ConsoleConfig class defines default values for console rendering, including rule width, indentation unit, locale, and box style. These defaults can be customized programmatically or loaded from a simpleterminal.properties file on the classpath.

Usage Example:

// Change defaults programmatically
ConsoleConfig.DEFAULT_RULE_WIDTH = 100;
ConsoleConfig.DEFAULT_INDENT_UNIT = "  ";
ConsoleConfig.DEFAULT_LOCALE = Locale.GERMAN;
ConsoleConfig.DEFAULT_BOX_STYLE = BoxStyle.DOUBLE;

// Or load from properties file
ConsoleConfig.loadDefaults();
Since:
0.1.0

  • Field Details

    • DEFAULT_RULE_WIDTH

      public static int DEFAULT_RULE_WIDTH
      The default width for horizontal rules.

      This value is used by console rendering components when drawing horizontal separators.

    • DEFAULT_INDENT_UNIT

      public static String DEFAULT_INDENT_UNIT
      The default unit of indentation.

      Typically a sequence of spaces or a tab character. Used by ConsoleBuilder when indenting output.

    • DEFAULT_LOCALE

      public static Locale DEFAULT_LOCALE
      The default locale for internationalized messages.

      Determines which resource bundle is used for localized output.

    • DEFAULT_BOX_STYLE

      public static BoxStyle DEFAULT_BOX_STYLE
      The default box style for framed content.

      Defines which BoxStyle is used when no explicit style is provided.

  • Method Details

    • loadDefaults

      public static void loadDefaults()
      Loads default configuration values from a simpleterminal.properties file.

      The file is expected to be located on the classpath. Supported keys:

      • rule.width - integer value for rule width
      • indent.unit - string value for indentation unit
      • locale - BCP 47 language tag (e.g. en, de-DE)
      • box.style - name of a predefined BoxStyle
      If the file is not found, defaults remain unchanged.
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if rule.width is not a valid integer
